availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Residence: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky. A Virginia-born carriage maker. Partnered with Stephen Severson in c1851, creating carriage making firm of Enders and Severson. Enders was senior partner.

bibl.p: "All Goes to His Wife," Louisville Courier-Journal, 28 Nov 1891, 12. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 9, p. 15.
"Stephen Severson Dead. Was for Many Years a Prominent Carriage Manufacturer," Louisville Courier-Journal, 10 Mar 1895, 21, ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
